actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

official_title: A bill to provide for a National Biological Survey, and for other purposes.
subjects: Advice and consent of the Senate

summary.text: National Biological Survey Act of 1993 - Title I: National Biological Survey - Directs the Secretary of the Interior (Secretary) to establish a National Biological Survey to: (1) consolidate and enhance biological research activities of the Department of the Interior; and (2) gather, analyze, and disseminate biological information to foster greater understanding and wise stewardship of the United States' living resources. Directs the Secretary to establish: (1) the National Biological Survey Science Council; and (2) the National Biological Survey Policy Board. Title II: Resource Management Training - Authorizes the Director of the National Biological Survey to develop a natural resource management training program. Provides for the confidentiality of information concerning the location of any candidate, threatened, or endangered species, with provisions for disclosure to Governors of affected States.

titles.title: A bill to provide for a National Biological Survey, and for other purposes.
